meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sleazy.
meanings.sent1: The sleaziness of the motel made me feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: I could sense the sleaziness of the used car salesman.
meanings.sent3: The sleaziness of the situation was evident from a mile away.
meanings.sent4: Her smile masked the sleaziness lurking beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The sleaziness of the deal left a stain on his reputation.

meanings.definition: Behavior or actions that are morally or ethically questionable.
meanings.sent1: His sleaziness was evident in the way he cut corners at work.
meanings.sent2: The politician's sleaziness was exposed by the media.
meanings.sent3: The sleaziness of his excuses was laughable.
meanings.sent4: The sleaziness of their scheme was like a dark cloud hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't ignore the sleaziness of his intentions.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or contempt towards something perceived as cheap or low-quality.
meanings.sent1: The sleaziness of the knock-off products was obvious.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her sleaziness towards the fake designer handbags.
meanings.sent3: The sleaziness she felt towards the fast food chain was comical.
meanings.sent4: The sleaziness of the imitation jewelry was like a slap in the face.
meanings.sent5: His sleaziness towards the budget hotel was palpable.
